intro: Carpesium hosokawae, commonly known as the Japanese thistle, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers with purple centers, typical of the genus Carpesium. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
